Name: Cha Cha Casares
Description:
Cha Cha was found beaten to death in a hotel room. She had extensive injuries to the back of the head.

> Bludgeon Slaying (Fresno Bee, Fresno, CA, USA, 1973-03-19)
>
> Police are also investigating the apparent bludgeon slaying of a 29-year-old whose body was found yesterday morning in a room in the Hotel Walters at 564 F St.
>
> Police said [Cha Cha] Casares was apparently killed some time between 3 a.m. and 10 a.m. yesterday. Jennie Hernandez, 47, who lives at the hotel told police she discovered the victim lying on the foot of the bed of her hotel room.
>
> She said Casares had been staying in her room off and on in recent weeks. Police said the victim was struck in the head, possibly with a metal chair which was in the room.
>
> Garfield Morgan Jr, 22, the night manager of the hotel told police he saw the victim at about 3 am with three men in the hotel hallway. He did not detect anything unusual at the time police said. When the [person] was found he was wearing women's clothing including a long-sleeved blouse, panty hose and a yellow mini skirt, police reported.

> Two Murderers Sought in Fresno (Californian, Salinias, CA, USA, 1973-03-19)
>
> Sunday morning, the body of [Cha Cha] Casares, 29, was found in a room at a west Fresno hotel.
>
> Police said Casares had suffered extensive injuries to the back of [their] head apparently incurred in a beating.
>
> Officers said Casares was believed to be a transvestite and when found was wearing womens undergarments.

> Weapon Seized (Fresno Bee, Fresno, CA, USA, 1973-04-06)
>
> Casares, also known as Cha Cha, was dressed in women’s clothing when [their] body was found officers said.

She was 29. #SayHerName #TransLivesMatter #TDoR
